title: Sanctuary 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a testament to oak, having aged in 80% new French barrels for 15 months. Ripe and intense, it melds tart black olive and clove with plush rounded layers of caramel and coffee.

title: Sketchbook 2015 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Well structured due to firm tannins and acidity, this full-bodied wine is also a good value. It will pair well with the richest proteins and has lightly earthy and spicy aromas, vivid and taut flavors like fresh blackberries and a nicely gripping mouthfeel.

title: South Stage 2015 Early Muscat (Rogue Valley)
description: As aromatic as expected of the variety, this has orange blossom, tangerine and orange pulp scents and flavors. With 21 g/L residual sugar, it's definitely off dry yet balanced with moderate acidity and low alcohol.

title: Summit Lake 2013 Emily Kestrel Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Muted in leathery tobacco, this is a thick wine sticky in woody tannin and dusty stoniness. Decadent and concentrated, it offers layers and layers of blackberry and chocolate.

title: Terragena 2013 Father and Son Blend Holden-Mapley Vineyard Red (Alexander Valley)
description: Cabernet Franc edges out its companion Cabernet Sauvignon 54% to 46% in this light-bodied quietly ripe wine. Sage, cedar and fresh herb provide a vegetal underbelly that will appeal to fans of those flavors and style, with a juicy underbelly that's marked by a tartness of cranberry.
designation: Father and Son Blend Holden-Mapley Vineyard

title: Thomas Schmitt 2015 Private Collection Estate Bottled Qualitätswein Pinot Noir (Mosel)
description: Pert, sunny red cherry and strawberry on the nose turn to bolder shades of black cherry and berry on the palate. It's a ripe, concentrated Pinot Noir, with a slightly earthen, savory character and strident, slightly bitter tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: Tommasi 2015  Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso
description: Aromas of dried black fruit, tobacco and carob lead the nose while the savory palate delivers prune, blackberry jam and a licorice accent. Velvety tannins provide polish. Drink through 2022.

title: Torii Mor 2015 Deux Verres Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Offering a bit more concentration than the regular Willamette Valley bottling, this carries the winery's citrus-tinged acids, along with light raspberry and Bing cherry fruit. There's a hint that it's spent some time in new oak also. Aerate aggressively for optimum drinking.

title: Tortoise Creek 2016 Cuvee Jeane Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: A light touch of cut grass leads to lemon rinds, citrus spray, Gala apples and a touch of guava on the nose of this widely available wine. It's clean and crisp on the palate, where stone fruit and apple flavors reign, set against a chalky texture.

title: Valetti 2016  Bardolino Classico
description: Made with 70% Corvina, 20% Rondinella and 10% Sangiovese, this offers aromas of red-skinned berry and dark spice. The soft, bright palate doles out red cherry and black pepper alongside lithe tannins. Drink soon.

title: Vital 2015 The Given Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Vibrant candied cherry, herb and baking spice aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors in this wine. The tannins bring a bit of grit to an otherwise enjoyable palate.

title: Wirra Wirra 2016 Scrubby Rise Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Adelaide)
description: Delicate aromas of apple skin, spring blossoms and lime zest carry the nose of this wine. The palate is a different beast all together, with far less fruitiness and far more minerality—tightly wound and chalky in texture. It's drinking well now, but would also be interesting to see it in a few years' time. Drink now–2020.

title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2015 Aspen Block Chardonnay (McMinnville)
description: This full-bodied, rather blocky wine delivers generic tree fruit flavors of the sort often found in Chardonnay. Brief aging in once-used barrels has added a touch of vanilla and toasted hazelnut.

title: Alfredo Roca 2014 Dedicatión Personal Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: This wine's edgy, feral berry aromas are accented with clove and mint. Its tight, choppy palate is saturated with plum and baked berry flavors and a mild green note of mint. It holds onto that herbal quality on the finish.

title: Animale 2014 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine's aromas are light but intriguing, with peat, cigar box, herb, flower and game notes. Its cherry and raspberry flavors are fresh and transparent, showing little apparent new oak influence. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2013 Estate Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a bright and expansive wine, brick in color, with aromas and flavors of bread, black cherry and leather. Grippy and powerful, it has a whiff of violet and plenty of length on the finish.

title: Bonny Doon 2013 Vin Gris Tuilé Rosé (Central Coast)
description: This is a very cerebral wine that will be too bizarre for many. The blend of 55% Grenache, 23% Mourvèdre, 10% Roussanne, 7% Cinsaut, 3% Carignane and 2% Grenache Blanc was allowed to sit in glass tanks in front of the sun for nine months, which gives the resulting wine a Sherry-like qualities: yellow-orange in color, with aromas and flavors of smoked walnuts, sour oranges, beeswax, honey and wood oil.

title: Adega dos Eidos 2016 Eidos de Padriñán Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of lime and dried mango are quiet on the nose. This Albariño has the feel of pulpy citrus fruits, while a mix of briny tropical fruit flavors turns a bit green and peppery on the finish.

title: Airfield Estates 2015 Dauntless Red (Yakima Valley)
description: Merlot makes up over two-thirds of this blend, with the balance in Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Baking spice, vanilla and plum aromas are at the fore. The tannins seem bunched up, however, and it lacks the generous fruit associated with the warm vintage.

title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Réserve Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: Blending four varieties—Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Gamay and Aligoté—this wine shows both rich fruitiness and a crisp texture. Citrus and apple dominate this tangy wine that finishes with attractive acidity.

title: Bergevin Lane 2013 She-Devil Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine's aromas lack clarity, with wood spice and butterscotch notes at the fore. The palate is full of lip-smacking, medium-bodied dark fruit flavors. Baking spice and coffee notes linger on the finish.

title: Birichino 2016 Vin Gris Rosé (California)
description: Light strawberry aromas meet with pink lemon and tangerine rinds on the simple nose of this bottling. The palate shows pleasant touches of strawberry and lemon as well as a touch of peat and pine smoke, but is missing some acidic boost.

title: Domaine Jacques Girardin 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: There is some good concentration in this ripe, structured wine. With its core of tannins and its surrounding red-berry and cherry fruit, it is rich and needs a little more time. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine Sangouard 2016 Les Rochettes  (Saint-Véran)
description: This is a creamy wine, open and with wood and vanilla flavors as well as ripe fruit. Juicy acidity brings in the necessary freshness. Its broad texture makes it immediately attractive and likely to be ready to drink soon.

title: Et Fille 2014 Kalita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This wine seems anxious, with an unfocused, nervous energy. Acidity, berry flavors, chalk and other mineral elements collide rather than combine. It may or may not improve with more bottle age. Two bottles were tasted, with comparable results.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This is a voluptuously lush white wine awash in pineapple, honeyed pear, vanilla and toasty oak. Moderate acidity supports its rich ripe fruit-forward nature.

title: Flower Garden 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Rheinhessen)
description: Earthier notes on first whiff dissipate with aeration to expose prettier aromas of strawberry and peach. The palate of this Pinot Noir rosé is distinctly citrusy with unexpected hints of vanilla and cream. Drink now.

title: García Figuero 2016 4 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy berry aromas are more gritty than smooth. This feels chunky and on the heavy side, with power but little finesse. Extracted blackberry and cassis flavors finish with overt oak, related chocolate notes and rough tannins.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2016 Gilgal Chardonnay (Galilee)
description: A nose of grapefruit and lemon with a hint of thyme sets the stage for flavors of lemon-lime, pineapple, vanilla and white flowers. This wine is bright from first sip until lingering citrus finish.

title: Helioterra 2014 Mourvèdre (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: From Heart of the Hill Vineyard on Red Mountain, this leads with vanilla, clove and baking spice aromas and follows with tart, tangy fruit and barrel flavors. Cranberry notes linger on the finish, along with interesting acidity.
